intro: Navarretia virgata, commonly known as the Sierra snowplant, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its rosette of narrow, grass-like leaves. The plant produces clusters of small, white, bell-shaped flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. It thrives in rocky, well-drained soils and is often found in alpine and subalpine habitats. Navarretia virgata is adapted to cold climates and is an important part of the local ecosystem in its native range.
